headline: Avocado Toast (Vegan)
description: Avocado is mashed with lemon juice, parsley, and just enough seasoning and spread on toast in this tasty and quick avocado toast recipe.
name: Avocado Toast (Vegan)

recipeInstructions.text: Toast bread in a toaster or toaster oven.
Scoop avocado into a bowl. Add parsley, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, pepper, onion powder, and garlic powder; mash together using a potato masher. Spread avocado mixture into each piece of toast.

review.reviewBody: So simple, quick and fresh, my new go-to recipe!
I used one fresh garlic clove rather than use powdered, did not use onion salt, used french bread as no multigrain on hand. Good.

This avocado toast recipe was very quick and easy to make. The only change I made was instead of using black pepper. I used red pepper for a little more kick. It was absolutely delicious definitely will make it again.
DEATH BY LEMON!! I added the juice of half of lemon as instructed and it was not edible. The next time I made this I used only a teaspoon of lemon juice and was excellent!
Delicious on protein bread/toast!
easy, delish! next time a little less lemon thank you
I made with out the parsley add 1/2 dised Italian tomatoes spooned out seeds, and 1/4 tsp salt. This recipe is so good all my guest loved it I had as a dip at a party and it was gone right away.
Good flavor but reduced seasonings due to small size of avocados. Fantastic with an egg on top!

I used sourdough bread instead of multi grain. I didn't have a lemon, so I used lime juice. Additionally, I thought that the garlic and onion powders were too much, so I used a bit less. I left out the olive oil and spread some margarine on the bread instead. DELICIOUS!
I recently had avocado toast at Dunkin’ Donuts. It was pretty good. I don’t care to eat donuts very often.
This was quick and tasty. I used a mixture of cilantro and parsley and instead of using toasted bread I used bagel chips which are already toasted and sliced into 1/4” circles. Perfect as appetizers.
Fantastic!
Very good! I used lime juice instead of lemon juice and chose to delete adding the salt. I put it on sprouted seed bread. Might be my new favorite for breakfast or lunch.
I followed the recipe 100% with no changes. I found it too salty and too lemony.
Really nice taste. I placed on Ezekiel bread.
Very nice! Was out of parsley so I added shredded basil
Loved this! I omitted the parsley and onion powder and it’s just delicious ??

This was my first attempt ever at making avocado toast. I followed the advice in other reviews and cut back on the amount of onion, garlic and salt. I used lime instead of lemon juice and I was out of olive oil, so I spread a little bit of vegan butter on my toast before adding the avacado. I think it turned out perfect! I will be making it again.

The first time I made this, the half a lemon was so tart we couldn’t handle it. Since then, I use a half a lime and it’s perfect. I serve it on toasted ancient grain bread with a tomato, and topped with a fried egg. It’s the best!
I left out the onion powder and parsley, and used lime juice and basil (because that's what I had on hand), and it turned out great.
Pretty good, but definitely taste as you go to adjust. I guess my avocado was on the smaller side so using a full avocado worked for for when the measurements were 1/4 across the board.
Made exactly as written but without the parsley. Pied it on two slices of double toasted gf bread. Spice balance was perfect. Highly recommend for anyone hesitant to try it.
Delicious!! An ardent advocate for avocado (say that 5 times real fast)

Pretty much the easiest avocado toast you'll ever make. If you don't have fresh lemon juice or parsley on hand, use the bottled & dried stuff if you will be eating it right away. In a pinch, it was not so noticeably different. I have made both and didn't notice a difference, to be honest.
It’s awesome, quick & healthy recipe but I add some mayo, oregano & tomatos too..

Just made this and its awesome! I made a couple of tweaks tho: Used 1/2 tbsp dried parsley instead of fresh, and used lemon juice (12-ish drops) from bottle. I also ended with 1/4 tsp garlic powder, 1/4 onion powder, 1/4 salt, 1/2 black pepper. Basically added everything according to my taste. I also added a sprinkle of smoked paprika on top. 
I also was unable to take a picture because it was gone before I realized I want to take a picture.

This is one of my go-to breakfast choices. Sooo yummy! I omit the parsley, but love the mix of all the other ingredients. I add chicken bacon strips on top for a little extra crunch, flavor and protein.
It was amazing! I would encourage everyone to try this!
Throw some cilantro and a fried egg or bacon for a non-vegan option. Yummy!

Made some changes since my avocado is small. A pinch each of all the seasonings and added red pepper flakes and a pinch of dried oregano. Omitted the olive oil. I also made this low carb and high protein so no toast but sliced a had boiled egg and topped the slices with the avocado. Delicious!!!!
Very easy to make and taste delicious
Simple to make and delicious!

Just made this and it’s delicious! Had only dried parsley so added 1tbsp (instead of 2 fresh) and omitted the oil. Not sure why that ingredient is even listed, it’s not needed! Added sliced tomato on top. Thanks! This was my first ‘avocado toast’ and definitely not my last.

This was a tasty, not fancy avocado toast recipe!! The only change I made was I omitted the olive oil and used a little plant butter on the toast before I spread on the avocado mixture. Very yummy! Great topped with some fresh tomato, too!
Fantastic
Super easy and delicious!

Great recipe - I loved it and so did my 2 year old. We skipped the parsley since we didn't have it available, and tried it on both white bread and gluten-free whole grain bread. Next time I'll try it with parsley and use less lemon, since it was a little too tart using 1/2 lemon.
Sometimes I replace all the spices with Tajin seasoning and top it with a poached egg.

I made it without parsley since I didn’t have any and I substituted calamansi for lemon cuz we have a tree that has fruit year round. Probably would’ve been better with lemon or more ripe calamansi since mine were still green, making it more sour than sweet. I made half the portion. It’s too salty for me... I’d say it better to just salt to taste. Added chia seeds after spreading the avo. Will try to make it again!
I have made it several times only change I make is doubling all ingredients except bread. I like to add a over easy egg also. Thanks for the great recipe.
The seasonings gave it good flavor, but 1/2 tsp of salt was a bit much. I’ll decrease the salt & lemon next time. I sprinkled a little bit of cumin on top just because I like cumin!

This was my first and only experience making and eating avocado toast. I started with the mashing, but then just scraped all of the ingredients into the food processor. Much quicker. Also, I think sprouts would be a nice touch for next time.
I love it! I tripled the recipe and added just a dash of hot sauce for a nice little kick.
Very easy to make and delicious. I added grape tomatoes. This will be a frequent breakfast.
I did not have parsley so used cilantro instead. I added cherry tomatoes. Used two slices of whole grain bread instead of four and added one egg. Satisfying!
I did not have parsley so used cilantro instead. I added cherry tomatoes. Used two slices of whole grain bread instead of four and added one egg. Satisfying!
Easy to make, tastes great, and filling. I saw no reason for the oil so I omitted it.
I used Cayenne pepper and warmed the spread for 30 seconds in a pan

I’ve never been a fan of avocados but we’re trying to incorporate more healthy fat in our diet so I thought I’d give this a try! When I made this I didn’t have any fresh parsley so I used the cilantro that I had on hand, and I only used half of the avocado so obviously, I halved the other ingredients as well. I tried it first without the egg and decided that I like it best with the fried egg on top of it. I’ll definitely be making this again. It tasted great!
super tasty! will make the meal again ^^
Delicious! There was a little too much lemon juice for my taste. I added an over easy egg on top with chia seeds.

Easy to make! I liked it much better once I skipped the lemon juice. (Although I did use lemon-flavored olive oil once since that’s what I had on hand, and that tasted good.) Like many others, I often add a fried egg on top. A splash of balsamic vinegar gives it a little zing.
Just tried this. Left out the parsley, but otherwise followed everything as written. Was a little too lemony, otherwise Turned out AMAZING.
I made this recipe for my son and I and it came out amazing!! We liked it so much, we had it two days in a row! The second day, I served it with a poached egg on top.
very easy to make, took no time and breakfast is ready

I made this for my breakfast this morning so scaled it to serve just 1. I didn't have fresh parsley so I used fresh cilantro like one other reviewer I read and left out the garlic powder. I pretty much eyeballed the portions and it turned out very good. I used it on my favorite bakery bread. I'd never thought of using avocado for breakfast but will certainly make it again for breakfast or even a snack. Thanks Carolyn for the recipe.
Yum! Fast. Easy. Delicious. The crisper the toast the better. Placed tomatoes on top to add some more veggies for it to be a small meal. Ate on gluten free Eban's bread. Will do it again.
The recipe as written has way too much spice for me. All I could taste was the garlic and onion powder so I cut all the spices in half and it was perfect!
Wow. Delish! These was so easy to make and in the AM, you don't want to be overwhelmed by spices. This was just right. Great idea!

This tasted great and was so easy to make. I made a couple of changes. I added a little bit of olive oil, and a very small amount of lemon juice. I served it on gluten-free rice crackers and a slightly peppery hard cheese ..
It was amazing!
I love this quick option. It is so good and packs
I reduced the salt by 1/3, still a little salty. put a fried egg on top for a delicious lunch.
i would make this again but decrease the salt alot
This is delicious, instead of parsley I used cilantro.
I like guacamole and added some chopped tomatoes and garlic to the recipe . It was great on toast!
Yummy recipe..... just adjusted salt but doesn’t detract from the flavor
I will make it again. As suggested, cut salt to 1/4 tsp. Delicious!
I will make it again. As suggested, cut salt to 1/4 tsp. Delicious!

This is good, but I think it has too much of all the ingredients except the avocado. I just used a sprinkle of everthing and only 1/4 a lemon. We only got 2 servings. This is the first time I've tried avocado on toast, and this recipe made me like it.
Pure comfort food.
It was good, too much Lemon and salt. I would repeat, but with 1/2 the salt and lemon.
I'd recommend a little bit less parsley. The olive oil does a lot for the texture.
It's so salty. I recommend using an ENTIRE avocado instead of just a half. It was much better this way, and I'll be making it again.
I love avocado so I was excited to try this recipe. It was very good but I put too much salt in it. I could have used a little less lemon as well (I used 1/2 like the recipe called for).
Delish on Killer Dave’s White Done Right.
I did not have lemon, so I substituted with lime. I also had no cilantro or onion powder. Still very good! Can't wait to try it again by following the exact recipe!
Since I was doing 1 serving and in a hurry I used about 1/3 of an avocado, just added pepper, lemon juice and topped it with a fried egg all on a slice of toasted pumpernickel rye. Excellent!
I used Lawry's garlic salt. I sprinkled toasted sesame seeds on the avocado once spread on the toast. delicoius!
Me and my husband love it. Thank u for sharing
Only half the salt is enough. Add more after tasting just in case.
It was very tasty. I added a few more seasonings. It was perfect on toasted whole grain bread.
It was pretty good although the garlic proportions are a bit off and I would recommend using less.
Delicious!! Loved it! I used lemon juice instead of fresh lemon. I think I used a tad too much but it’s yummy

Delicious! I plan to save some for later....that didn't happen. I tried with toast, crackers and semi-toasted bread also. It's best with well toasted bread. The seasonings are balanced well and provides a very nice flavor. Will be making this one again!
I didn't add in the pepper but other than that I followed the recipe, and it turned out just fine. It tastes much better than plain avocado toast.
This was very easy to make and turned out great. I topped it with a slice of tomato. I will make this again soon.
I made it as-is EXCEPT I forgot to buy parsley but it was still fantastic. I’ve made it twice now!

I never cared for avocado until I found this recipe. I'm trying to eat healthier foods so I was determined to find something. This is the recipe that won me over. I have it on toasted chia cracked rye from Izzio. Excellent bread as well.

Very good. I used half lime juice and half lemon juice. I cut the salt in half, and added dried diced jalapeño for extra flavor. I didn’t have garlic powder so I used a more garlic paste. Then serves it on Ezekiel bread and sprinkled it with crumbled feta. Wish I had some chopped tomatoes
Yum! Great -perfect! Love it for breakfast or lunch!
This was very good though my avocado was not as ripe as I hoped. Since it was small, I adjusted the ingre. and enjoyed it very much.
It was OK, but it was too bitter for me with that quantity of lemon juice.

I *love* avocado toast! My Nana used to make almost this exact recipe for me when I was little. We would go out into the yard and pick an avocado, warmed by the sun, and bring it inside to make fresh avocado toast. The only thing she did different was use less salt and sometimes use a little dot of mayo instead of olive oil. YUM! Thank you for bringing back the taste of my childhood! =)
Nice, refreshing change from our usual eggs or cereal breakfast.
I followed the original recipe with one avocado and it was way too strong. Luckily I had a second on hand to "water it down." The recipe was great! Will make it again
It was good. Would make it again with less lemon.
Even without the olive oil it's delicious! Easy to make and calls for few readily available ingredients!

I had a small avocado that needed to be used, and this fit the bill. The amounts of the ingredients added were according to my own preference. I couldn't find my parsley so I added dried cilantro; lime juice would work here if you didn't have the lemon available. It was a nice light lunch on a hot day. I can see adding an egg for protein, as some reviewers mentioned. UPDATE 8/2/17: Liked it better with lime juice, all ingredients except no parsley or cilantro, and topped with a little crushed red pepper flakes. Simple & delicious.
I don't like onion, so i did it without. To my taste it was too sour. I'll cook it again, as it's a very hearty and fairly quick breakfast, but I'll add less lemon juice.
